mortality.note: Jewish deaths estimated 100,000-200,000. Some contemporary accounts claim higher. Hundreds of Jewish communities destroyed. Total deaths including Poles much higher.

rationales.systematic_intensity: Coordinated attacks on Jewish communities across Ukraine. Synagogues destroyed, forced conversions, mass killings.
rationales.profit: Jews targeted partly as economic intermediaries for Polish nobles. Property seized. Economic resentment exploited.
rationales.ideology: Religious hatred, Jews blamed as agents of Polish oppression. Orthodox Christian vs Jewish dimension.
rationales.complicity: Cossack forces, local peasants participated. Crimean Tatars allied. Poland unable to protect.

analysis.pattern_note: One of the worst massacres of Jews before the Holocaust. Khmelnytsky is a national hero in Ukraine but this aspect is often minimized. Jews were targeted as visible agents of Polish landlords - economic scapegoating combined with religious hatred. Created lasting trauma in Jewish collective memory. Demonstrates how economic resentment + religious difference = mass violence.
warning_signs: Jews scapegoated as agents of oppression
Religious hatred combined with economic resentment
Minority identified with unpopular ruling class
analysis.root_causes: Cossack grievances against Poland, economic role of Jews as intermediaries, Orthodox-Catholic-Jewish tensions, weak state protection

sources.title: Jewish Life in Ukraine: A Historical Overview
sources.author: Paul Robert Magocsi
